B (iovoynment.),: -SE 0 RETCABINET 5 (SS) .CONCLUSIONS-of a Meeting of the Cabinet,held at 10, Downing Street,^S-^VV-1, onWEDNESDAY, JANUARY 31, 19S3, at 4 p*m.INTER-ALLIEDDEBT.Funding ofthe BritishDebt to theUnited Statesof America,,- 7(Previous- Reference.:' Cabinet 4(23), Con-elusion S ..-)- On further consideration of the question of theAnglo-American Debt., the Cabinet agreed --(a) That the proposal of the United StatesFunding Commission should be accepted inprinciple:(b) That the Treasury should, draft a telegram,for the approval of the Prime Minister,setting forth the terms of the acceptanceand dealing with any outstanding details.Including, if the Chancellor of theExchequer deemed.it advisable, an expres-eion of the desire of the Cabinet thatthe bonds should not be negotiated for aperiod of ten years.2, Whitehall Gardens, S.W.1,January 31, 1923,
